item.title: Video: Virat Kohli's Act To Unsettle Sam Konstas Leads To Heated Clash On Field - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Video: Virat Kohli's Act To Unsettle Sam Konstas Leads To Heated Clash On Field

Date: December 26, 2024 Source: NDTV

During the Boxing Day Test in Melbourne, Australian debutant Sam Konstas fiercely batted against India, leading to a heated exchange with Virat Kohli. Despite attempts to unsettle him, Konstas maintained his form to score a half-century.

  • Sam Konstas scored a 52-ball half-century on his Test debut.
  • Virat Kohli attempted to disrupt Konstas with a shoulder push.
  • The altercation escalated, prompting intervention from players and umpires.
  • Konstas became the fourth youngest Test debutant for Australia, making his debut at age 19 years and 85 days.
“Virat Kohli and Sam Konstas exchanged a heated moment on the MCG.” — cricket.com.au

This match showcases the competitive spirit of cricket and the challenges faced by debutants in high-pressure situations.

item.title: IND vs AUS 4th Test, Day 1 Live Updates, Reactions: Sam Konstas' audacious fifty puts Australia in command - India Today
item.description:
IND vs AUS 4th Test, Day 1 Live Updates: Sam Konstas Dismissed by Jadeja

Date: Dec 26, 2024 | Source: Multiple

The 4th Test between India and Australia has started with exciting moments, including Sam Konstas's impressive debut and a critical wicket by Ravindra Jadeja that has swung the momentum.

  • Sam Konstas scored 60 runs before being dismissed by Jadeja.
  • The current batsmen are Marnus Labuschagne and Usman Khawaja.
  • The match is taking place at the Melbourne Cricket Ground (MCG).
“It's quite surreal. Look at the turnout (of the crowd). I'm just trying to play with some freedom and back myself.” - Sam Konstas

This match promises to be a thrilling contest as both teams step up their game on this significant stage.

item.title: IND vs AUS 4th Test: Shubman Gill dropped, Washington Sundar comes in; Australia opt to bat vs India - The Times of India
item.description:
IND vs AUS 4th Test: Shubman Gill dropped, Washington Sundar comes in; Australia opt to bat vs India

Publication Date: December 29, 2023

Source: Times of India

Australia won the toss and opted to bat first in the fourth Test at the Melbourne Cricket Ground (MCG). India made a notable change by dropping Shubman Gill and including Washington Sundar in the lineup.

  • Rohit Sharma confirmed the team change, emphasizing the team's readiness to compete in a close series (1-1).
  • Pat Cummins expressed confidence in batting first, noting the good condition of the pitch with some grass.
  • The series remains competitive following India’s previous win and Australia’s victory in the second Test.
“We would have batted as well, looks like a good wicket. The series is 1-1, a lot to play for.” - Rohit Sharma

The Boxing Day Test is crucial for both teams as they aim for series victory following an exciting draw in the previous match.

item.title: "Disservice to the game": Ravichandran Ashwin makes a strong statement on not getting farewell after his retirement - Crictoday
item.description:
“Disservice to the game”: Ravichandran Ashwin makes a strong statement on not getting farewell after his retirement

Publication Date: September 2024 | Source: Crictoday

Ravichandran Ashwin revealed that he does not believe in grand farewells following his retirement from international cricket, which surprised many in the cricket community.

  • Ashwin announced his retirement after the third Test against Australia.
  • He responded to Kapil Dev's suggestion of a grand farewell, stating he does not want such recognition.
  • Ashwin's decision was sudden and caught even his close teammates off guard.
  • He emphasized that farewells are a disservice to the game.
  • Ashwin plans to remain connected with cricket and will play for Chennai Super Kings in IPL 2025.
“For me, farewells are wrong... I never wanted a grand farewell for myself.”

Ashwin expressed no regrets about his retirement and affirmed he values his achievements as a cricketer.

item.title: 'Second to none' Mohammad Abbas ready for his redemption arc - ESPNcricinfo
item.description:
Second to none: Mohammad Abbas ready for his redemption arc

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: ESPNcricinfo

Mohammad Abbas, returning to the Pakistan Test team after a three-year absence, showcases his exceptional bowling skills and team spirit as he prepares for the upcoming series in South Africa. Despite the mystery surrounding his exclusion from the team, his consistent performances at Hampshire have earned him this much-deserved opportunity.

  • Abbas has taken 180 wickets at an average of 19.26 over the past three seasons with Hampshire.
  • He last played for Pakistan in August 2021, demonstrating his prowess with a ten-wicket haul against Australia.
  • Coaches and teammates believe his skillset is crucial for the team’s success in South Africa.
  • During his absence, other fast bowlers have emerged, but Abbas remains the most prolific bowler in first-class cricket since his last Test match.
  • His return is seen as a chance to correct past mistakes and showcase his talent on the international stage.

"His skill is second to none." - Shan Masood, Pakistan Test captain

The cricket community awaits Abbas’s performance as he returns to represent Pakistan, hopeful for a successful redemption.

item.title: Yasir and Ali star as ABL Stallions trump UMT Markhors to win Bahria Town Champions T20 Cup - PCB
item.description:
Yasir and Ali star as ABL Stallions trump UMT Markhors to win Bahria Town Champions T20 Cup

Date: 25 December 2024, Source: PCB

A swashbuckling hundred from opener Yasir Ali and a brilliant bowling display by Mohammad Ali led ABL Stallions to a 75-run victory over UMT Markhors in the Bahria Town Champions T20 Cup final held at Rawalpindi Cricket Stadium.

  • Yasir scored 100 runs off 57 balls, hitting seven sixes and five boundaries.
  • ABL Stallions set a target of 200 runs, finishing their innings at 199-5.
  • UMT Markhors were bowled out for 124 runs in 19.1 overs.
  • Mohammad Ali took 3 wickets for 19 runs, while Usman Tariq took 2 wickets for just 10 runs.
  • This victory marks another title for ABL Stallions in Pakistan’s T20 history.
Player of the Final - Yasir Khan (ABL Stallions)
Player of the Tournament - Mohammad Ali (ABL Stallions)

The ABL Stallions celebrate another championship win, dominating throughout the tournament.

item.title: India vs Australia 4th Test, Melbourne weather forecast: Will MCG suffer Gabba fate with WTC final spot at stake? - Hindustan Times
item.description:
India vs Australia 4th Test, Melbourne Weather Forecast: Will MCG Suffer Gabba Fate with WTC Final Spot at Stake?

Date: December 25, 2024 08:42 PM IST
Source: Hindustan Times

As the fourth Test match of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy series approaches, the spotlight is on both the teams and the Melbourne weather, particularly with World Test Championship (WTC) qualification at stake.

  • The previous game in Brisbane ended in a draw, keeping the series tied at 1-1 after three matches.
  • Australia lost Josh Hazlewood to injury and replaced him with Scott Boland, while India has named uncapped Tanush Kotian to replace retiree Ravichandran Ashwin.
  • The Melbourne weather forecast predicts minimal rain for the first three days, with only a 24% chance of rain expected on Day 3.
  • India's hopes of qualifying for the WTC final hinge on the outcome of this match, as a loss or draw would eliminate them.
  • Australia also has upcoming matches that impact their qualification chances.
If India loses or draws, they could be eliminated from the race to the WTC final.

The outcome of this Test match is crucial for both teams as they aim for a spot in the WTC final, with weather conditions also playing a significant role in the proceedings.

item.title: Anushka Sharma-Virat Kohli Step Out For A Romantic Date; Kriti Sanon Celebrates Christmas With Beau Kabir B - News18
item.description:
Anushka Sharma and Virat Kohli Enjoy Christmas Date in Melbourne

Date: December 26, 2024

Source: News18

Anushka Sharma and Virat Kohli were spotted enjoying a romantic date in Melbourne on Christmas Day, strolling casually without their children.

  • The couple was dressed casually, with Virat in blue pants and a dark tee, and Anushka in beige pants and a black tee.
  • They appeared to relish a quick snack during their outing.
  • Kriti Sanon shared glimpses of her own celebrations with her rumored boyfriend, Kabir Bahia, highlighting MS Dhoni playing Santa Claus.
“Kriti Sanon made Christmas a little merrier for her fans by sharing sneak peeks of her star-studded, love-filled celebrations.”

This casual outing of the celebrity couple generated interest among fans, reflecting a moment of normalcy amidst their busy lives.

item.title: 'Grand farewells are wrong': Ashwin reacts to Kapil Dev's remark - The Times of India
item.description:
'Grand Farewells Are Wrong': Ashwin Reacts to Kapil Dev's Remark

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Times of India

In a new statement, Indian cricketer Ravichandran Ashwin has expressed his disagreement with Kapil Dev's remarks regarding grand farewells for cricketers, suggesting a more humble approach.

  • Ashwin believes that cricket is a team sport and does not support the notion of extravagant farewells.
  • Kapil Dev had previously shared his thoughts on how cricketers deserve a grand send-off.
  • The debate highlights differing perspectives on how players should be honored following their careers.
Ashwin stated, "Every player's contribution to the game is important, but we are here to play cricket, not to make a spectacle of farewells."

This discussion opens up questions about the future of cricket farewells and how they resonate with fans and players alike.

item.title: Pakistan bring back Babar and go with four pacers for Centurion Test - ESPNcricinfo
item.description:
Pakistan Bring Back Babar and Opt for Four Pacers in Centurion Test

Publication Date: December 25, 2024

Source: ESPN Cricinfo

Pakistan will face South Africa in the Boxing Day Test at Centurion with a bowling attack featuring four pacers and no specialist spinner, marking the return of Babar Azam to the lineup.

Key Points:

  • Babar Azam returns to the team after being dropped from the previous Tests against England.
  • Pakistan selects four seamers: Aamer Jamal, Naseem Shah, Mohammad Abbas, and Khurram Shahzad.
  • Shan Masood will open alongside Saim Ayub, while Abdullah Shafique has been left out due to poor form.
  • The team has opted for an all-pace attack, considering the seam-friendly conditions of the Centurion pitch.
“Since the Australia series, we've backed Aamer Jamal... He’s handy when it reverses and useful at being the enforcer.” - Shan Masood

This match will be critical as both teams rely on seam bowling, highlighting the importance of pitch conditions for the upcoming Test.

item.title: MS Dhoni turns Santa Claus for daughter Ziva, wife Sakshi and Kriti Sanon, photos go viral - India.com
item.description:
MS Dhoni turns Santa Claus for daughter Ziva, wife Sakshi and Kriti Sanon, photos go viral

Publication Date: December 2024 | Source: India.com

MS Dhoni brought holiday cheer to his home by dressing as Santa Claus for Christmas 2024, delighting his daughter Ziva, wife Sakshi, and actress Kriti Sanon, with photos from their celebration quickly going viral.

  • Dhoni's Santa outfit featured his nickname 'Mahi' on the hat.
  • The social media post accumulated over 500,000 likes within hours.
  • Kriti Sanon also participated in the joyous celebrations, sharing moments with fans.
  • Dhoni remains a beloved sports icon even after his retirement.
“The ex-India captain is seen dressed as Santa Claus, with his wife and daughter Ziva by his side.”

This festive occasion highlighted Dhoni's family values and ability to connect with fans through social media, reinforcing his status as a beloved figure in Indian cricket.

item.title: R Ashwin Watches Travis Head's Training Video, Pinpoints His Exact Game Plan - NDTV Sports
item.description:
R Ashwin Analyzes Travis Head's Training Techniques Ahead of Crucial Test

Date: December 25, 2024
Source: NDTV

Travis Head has emerged as a major challenge for India in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, having scored two centuries already. R Ashwin reviews Head's recent net practice video, noting his strategic focus on addressing weaknesses against specific deliveries.

  • Travis Head's performance has been crucial for Australia in the ongoing Border-Gavaskar Trophy.
  • He has scored 152 and 140 in the second and third Tests, respectively.
  • Ashwin analyzes a video of Head training to defend against deliveries from round the wicket.
  • Head is currently the highest run-scorer in the series, with 409 runs in three Tests.
“Omg! He is getting to the off stump? Is that the ploy for round the stumps?” — Ashwin (@ashwinravi99)

Ashwin's insights reflect his continued engagement with cricket, despite his recent retirement from international play.

item.title: Can struggling Virat Kohli overcome batting blues at favourite MCG? - The Times of India
item.description:
Can Virat Kohli Overcome Recent Batting Struggles at MCG?

Date: December 26, 2023 Source: Times of India

As the Boxing Day Test at the iconic MCG approaches, Virat Kohli seeks to recover from recent batting inconsistency during the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.

  • Kohli's recent performance shows scores of 5, 100*, 7, 11, and 3, accumulating 126 runs with an average of 31.50.
  • Historically, Kohli has performed well at MCG, with an average of 52.66 and a highest score of 169.
  • Ravi Shastri comments on Kohli's form, suggesting patience and discipline are key to overcoming challenges.
  • Matthew Hayden advises Kohli to take cues from Sachin Tendulkar's strategy during his 2004 Sydney Test innings.
“If Virat gets over that first 30, 40 minutes, with serious application and discipline, I don't think he's (out of form).” - Ravi Shastri

Fans are hopeful that the festive atmosphere of the Boxing Day Test will help Kohli rediscover his batting prowess and silence his critics.

item.title: MS Dhoni Sets Internet Ablaze With New 'Santa Claus' Look, Poses With Wife Sakshi And Daughter Ziva - NDTV Sports
item.description:
MS Dhoni Sets Internet Ablaze With New 'Santa Claus' Look, Poses With Wife Sakshi And Daughter Ziva

Publication Date: December 25, 2024 | Source: NDTV

Legendary India captain MS Dhoni has delighted fans with a new festive look as Santa Claus shared by his wife Sakshi. The post has gone viral, gathering over 500,000 likes shortly after being posted.

  • Dhoni disguised as Santa Claus with wife Sakshi and daughter Ziva.
  • The Instagram post quickly gained massive traction online.
  • Dhoni remains a beloved figure in Indian cricket despite his retirement from international cricket over five years ago.
  • He will be playing for Chennai Super Kings (CSK) in the IPL 2025 season.
  • Dhoni was retained for Rs 4 crore under a new rule benefiting players who haven't played internationally for over five years.
"Glimpses of the legendary captain send fans into a frenzy."

Dhoni continues to maintain a strong connection with his fans, showcasing his charismatic personality even during the holiday season.

item.title: Vinod Kambli to Prithvi Shaw: Top Indian cricketers who disappeared all of sudden - India.com
item.description:
Vinod Kambli to Prithvi Shaw: Top Indian cricketers who disappeared all of sudden

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: India.com

Numerous Indian cricketers have shown immense promise but have suddenly faded from the forefront of the sport. Various factors, including injuries and off-field troubles, have derailed their careers.

  • Players like Vinod Kambli and Prithvi Shaw had early success but faced challenges that limited their time in the spotlight.
  • Others, such as S. Sreesanth, gained fame from notable achievements, only for controversies to hinder their career progression.
  • Intense competition has seen promising talents like Mayank Agarwal and Manish Pandey struggle to maintain their places in the national team.
  • Injuries have significantly impacted cricketers like Varun Aaron, who showcased potential but ultimately could not sustain their performance.
  • Fitness issues have also played a role in Prithvi Shaw's recent career struggles.
“He had the potential to become one of the game's greatest players.” - Insights on Prithvi Shaw's career potential.

This examination of Indian cricketers illustrates how factors beyond talent can significantly affect a player's career trajectory.

item.title: Revealed: Manchester United’s new plan for Harry Amass amid Aston Villa transfer interest - UtdDistrict
item.description:
Manchester United's Future Plans for Harry Amass Amid Aston Villa Interest

Date: November 15, 2024
Source: UtdDistrict

Manchester United's 17-year-old talent Harry Amass is poised for a new chapter as the club plans to send him on loan due to limited first-team opportunities under new head coach Ruben Amorim.

  • Amass showed promise during pre-season and was included on the bench for several matches, including an FA Cup semi-final.
  • After joining United from Watford in 2023, he has been a standout for the club's youth teams, including a key role in their treble-winning U18 campaign.
  • Erik ten Hag had envisioned a breakthrough for Amass, but recent coaching changes have shifted priorities towards experienced players.
  • United plans to loan Amass in January to give him competitive playing time.
  • Aston Villa is interested in a permanent deal for Amass, but United is currently not considering any approaches.
“A loan deal makes the most sense for Amass, allowing him to prove himself in a competitive first-team environment.”

In conclusion, as Manchester United seeks to balance youth development with team performance, Harry Amass's potential loan signifies a strategic shift to enhance his growth and performance prospects.

item.title: A Closer Look At PV Sindhu’s Wedding Saree - NDTV Movies
item.description:
PV Sindhu's Wedding Saree Designed by Manish Malhotra

Publication Date: February 3, 2024 | Source: Swirlster

Badminton champion PV Sindhu is set to marry Venkata Datta Sai, showcasing a stunning wedding saree designed by celebrated designer Manish Malhotra.

  • PV Sindhu's elegant wedding attire is a highlight of her upcoming nuptials.
  • The saree reflects a blend of traditional elements and modern fashion.
  • Manish Malhotra continues to create a buzz with his designer collections for bridal wear.
“A perfect blend of tradition and modernity,” said a fashion critic.

This wedding saree not only emphasizes Sindhu's personal style but also highlights the collaboration between sports and fashion.

item.title: Mohammed Shami, Sania Mirza Marry Each Other? Here's Truth About Viral Nikaah Photos - Oneindia
item.description:
Mohammed Shami and Sania Mirza: Viral Wedding Photos Debunked

Updated: December 25, 2024 [IST] | Source: OneIndia

The internet buzzes with rumors as photographs of cricketer Mohammed Shami and Tennis star Sania Mirza dressed as a bride and groom went viral. However, these images have been fact-checked and proven to be AI-generated.

  • The viral photos depict Mohammed Shami in a cream indo-western outfit and Sania Mirza in a pink lehenga.
  • Claims suggest the images were taken at their wedding ceremony, leading to widespread speculation.
  • Fact-checking revealed no evidence from social media or family confirming their marriage.
  • AI technology was identified as the source of the morphed images, previously connected to fake Christmas celebrations.
  • Social media users are warned to be cautious of deepfake technology.
No! Mohammed Shami and Sania Mirza have not married each other and the viral photos are AI generated.

The rumor surrounding Mohammed Shami and Sania Mirza's alleged marriage has been debunked, with the viral images dismissed as fake.

item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.

item.title: Rohit Sharma Replaces KL Rahul; Shubman Gill OUT: India Likely Playing XI For Boxing Day Test - Times Now
item.description:
Rohit Sharma Replaces KL Rahul; Shubman Gill OUT: India Likely Playing XI For Boxing Day Test

Publication Date: N/A Source: Times Now

India are currently level 1-1 in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy and seek to take a lead in the series during the Boxing Day Test at the MCG. Changes in the lineup are expected to improve their chances for World Test Championship qualification.

  • Rohit Sharma returns to open the batting, replacing KL Rahul.
  • Shubman Gill dropped; Dhruv Jurel slated to bat at no.6.
  • Washington Sundar replaces Nitish Kumar Reddy in the all-rounder slot.
  • Virat Kohli and Rishabh Pant remain at positions 4 and 5.
  • India's likely playing XI: Rohit Sharma (c), Yashasvi Jaiswal, KL Rahul, Virat Kohli, Rishabh Pant (wk), Dhruv Jurel, Ravindra Jadeja, Washington Sundar, Akash Deep, Jasprit Bumrah, Mohammed Siraj.

item.title: Sunil Gavaskar explains why India should not drop Nitish Reddy for Boxing Day Test - The Times of India
item.description:
Sunil Gavaskar explains why India should not drop Nitish Reddy for Boxing Day Test

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Times of India

The Border-Gavaskar Trophy is at a crucial point, tied at 1-1, as India prepares for the Boxing Day Test in Melbourne. Key discussions revolve around player selections, particularly concerning Nitish Kumar Reddy.

  • Ravichandran Ashwin's retirement creates a gap, leading to Tanush Kotian's selection as a replacement.
  • Sunil Gavaskar argues against dropping Nitish Reddy, emphasizing his role as a fourth seamer.
  • Reddy's performance has been lackluster, but his batting is seen as vital for team balance.
  • Adjustments to the top order include Rohit Sharma returning as an opener and K.L. Rahul possibly batting at number three.
  • Akash Deep's place is considered secure after his performance at the Gabba.
“They can’t drop Nitish Kumar Reddy. He is the fourth seamer. I can’t see India going in with just two pacers and Nitish. For me, it is pretty much this XI that plays in Melbourne,” - Sunil Gavaskar.

The upcoming Boxing Day Test is crucial for India's chances in the series, with significant discussions around player formations and their potential impacts.
